radios.title: CJSF Radio - CJSF-FM

radio_info.short: CJSF broadcasts from the Burnaby mountain campus of Simon Fraser University at 90.1 FM to most of Greater Vancouver, from Langley to Point Grey and
radio_info.rest:
from the North Shore to the US Border. It is also available on 93.9 FM cable in the communities of SFU, Burnaby, New Westminister, Coquitlam, Port Coquitlam, Port Moody, Surrey and Delta, in British Columbia Canada and through MP3 streaming and through a speaker located just outside the station. CJSF is on 7 days a week between the hours of 8AM-2AM.

------

radio_info.short: Who we are and what we do... At Giant FM we do things differently. As the Okanagan's only independent radio station, we have a unique
radio_info.rest:
knowledge of the Okanagan's history and background - it really is where we live, work and play. We understand first-hand the challenges of operating a business here - we've been doing so for more than 25 years. We take pride in our unique ties to the Okanagan by bringing you great music, entertaining personalities and up-to-date relevant local news. Giant FM covers the Okanagan and Similkameen Valleys in the South Central Interior of British Columbia, Canada; a total potential audience of over 337,000 listeners. (Source: 2004 census statistics Canada) For personalized service and creative, effective ways of marketing your business, we are here to serve you - give us a call!

A few questions... and some answers!
What can you tell me about GIANT FM?

October 1982 Ralph Robinson fulfilled a life long dream of owning his own radio station and went on the air as 100.7 CIGV "Great Valley's" radio. Ralph and CIGV 100.7 went on to become an integral part of the growth of the Okanagan and worked tirelessly promoting community projects. Ralph's devotion to maintaining a strong sense of community within the Okanagan is legend, and remains the corner-stone of 100.7 GIANT FM's business ethic today. Based in Penticton, BC we have the largest 'footprint' in the valley. In keeping with tradition we continue to bring you "Today's Best Country" with an exciting mix of upcoming new musicians, original artists and just the right blend of eclectic gems to keep the sound fresh and unique.

What kind of music does GIANT FM play?

New Country and Adult Contemporary including... Sugar Land ~ George Canyon ~ Johnny Reid ~ Keith Urban ~ Dixie Chicks ~ Shania Twain ~ Gretchen Wilson ~ Brad Paisley ~ Trace Adkins ~ Faith Hill ~ Tim McGraw ~ Montgomery Gentry ~ Jessie Farrell ~ Dierks Bentley ~ Taylor Swift and contemporary classics from Allan Jackson, George Strait and more including a down-to-earth Blues Hour Monday nights and unique artists such as The Reggae Cowboys ~ Lucinda Williams and John Prine

What are the demographics of your listeners?

Baby Boomers - 35 to 65 - Giant FM features flexible programming providing an entertaining and informative mix of music and talk with an emphasis on local news stories and events.

Where in the world is Giant FM?

Find us on the map!

radio_info.short: The receiver is located 32km's (20 miles)SE of Vancouver in Langley. The railroads heard are BCRail "Port Sub", CN "Yale Sub", CP "Cascade Sub", BNSF
radio_info.rest:
"North Branch--Bellingham Sub " and BNSF New Westminster Sub.Sourthern Rail or "SRY" from New Westminster to the valley town of Chilliwack.
You will hear Amtrak and BNSF trains calling the Port Sub RTC for clearances at Colebrook as this is where the BNSF crosses the Port Sub.
CN, CP run coal and stack trains from the container port at Roberts Bank so they must call for clearances when leaving going East and when entering from the east going west.
For first time listener's to a Canadian stream you will hear the term RTC which is the abreviation for rail traffic controller (Dispatcher) or DS as you hear in the USA.
 Coverage from the CDN/USA border down as far as South Bellingham.Weather depending you will hear at times as far as Mt Vernon.
